author: rootsid
title: RootsWallet - iPhone version
description: RootsWallet, the open source identity wallet for ATALA Prism is available for Android due to limitations on Prism SDK. A new Javascript Prism SDK that is coming soon will allow an iPhone version.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has provided a clear and concise description of the issue they are trying to solve: RootsWallet is only available for Android and missing the audience using iOS.

The proposal will very likely have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem, by providing the first source identity wallet for ATALA Prism on iPhones.

This proposal addresses the challenge very effectively, I, therefore, rate IMPACT a 5 out of 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers provided a short description of who they are (Rodolfo Miranda, Lance Byrd), including their roles, experience, and past work. They have Cardano/Catalyst/Atala Prism qualifications and have successfully completed past Catalyst proposals in FUND 6 to 8. There is therefore complete confidence that the team can bring this proposal to term.

Although quite technical, the budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items. Additional funding is not required to implement the proposal, but it is not excluded depending on future needs to maintain interoperability. The budget and the timetable (total of 3 months) seem to be reasonable to achieve the set goals. The proposer provided a detailed roadmap for this proposal as well as a list of actionable tasks to complete.
The proposal also clearly explains technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies that are crucial for this implementation.

Given the experience and plan presented, it is very likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided a clear and detailed roadmap with milestones (integration of new SDK, dev, testing, and documentation) and a time horizon for achievement (3 months). The KPIs that define the success of the proposal are presented, make sense and can be used by the community to track the progress of the proposal. I rate auditability a 5/5.

f6_assessments.q0:
As ATALA Prism is where maximum transaction happens, Developing and operationalizing
RootsWallet which is mobile accessible is great idea. But due to limitations as its only 
available for Android phones is regretful.
But proposer idea of making it available for

As they found new Java script which will make it available soon. RootsID will be using new javascript version and build rootswallet for apple phones.
As it will be available  for all new ATALA prism for apple version rootswallet many can use it uses,
I strongly agree with  this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
As it is already existing project which needs modifications and changes and updating new javascript in many areas.
As plan and all working model is ready for android users and needs to build for IOS.
They have provided detailed and timemap which is great.
and they are ready to deliver within 3 months and only risk is SDK delivery I think it wont be so much problem as they are talking already.
They have provided detailed budget breakdown and explained everywhere they need money. So i feel its sensible amount is requested.
As of team they have already delivered many projects from past funding rounds which is nice track record.
 With given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
As this project wont need funding after this round and Apple store anybody can check and track for progress . They will be providing all methods in GitHub and they will be providing intermediate reports also in Sprint Burndown, And They will be showing in KPIs the percentage of  progress in public domain.
Looking at long-term goals they surely have nice ideas and integration makes easy accessible everywhere and  they have delivered all given goals in F7 which makes sensible to fund  this project and let community get benefits from them, 
As it will be benefiting all and all given data and information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Decentralized Identity is one of Cardano’s main claims to greatness in the future web3 world. The work done by the RootsID and Roots wallet team is a major part of the pioneering work for this. Connecting AtalaPRISM with real world use cases through wallet integration is important, and the iPhone has 55% market share, even more among certain Tech and VC demographics. This proposal matches the DApp, Products and Integrations challenge perfectly and is a good addition to the Roots portfolio.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal is dependent on the release of a Prism SDK based on JavaScript. We only learn that it will be released “soon”. The 12 weeks implementation phase and budget at $100/hour are well detailed and credible. The team behind RootsID is well known and impressive. In total, the team have 10 proposals in this fund which if all funded could pose some time constraints. It is however less relevant for this iPhone project, as it will most likely happen later in the year when the SDK is released. I like that 20 hours are reserved for testing and documentation, while these could have been budgeted cheaper than the development, it is a strong point to be included.
f6_assessments.q2: It is a little disappointing that the only deliverable is an iPhone version of the Roots wallet. There are no targets for number of downloads, user ranking or how long the Apple audit and implementation overall will take. The Github documentation of this project and high exposure of the team in the community make audit and communication very easy. I recommend that the proposers add some KPIs for quality, quantity and smooth launch. Releasing on Apple is a lot harder than Android in my experience.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal would be within the challenge goal, this is necessary tool and I think that this proposal probably will increase utility & adoption of Cardano Smart Contracts and DID  challenge and builted for a great community (developers and consumers). At the same time the statement of how problem is to be solved is explained with a technical elements of the offered services.
The proposal want to facilitate developers because RootsID will integrate the new Atala Prism Javascript SDK and build an iPhone version of RootsWallet.
This proposal is clear and concrete, based on RootsID experience and they are already delivering many projects on Cardano blockchain.  This is an important proposal to attract many new users to the Cardano ecosystem for developing many new applications.
The proposal clearly articulates the contest, the problem, the challenge and how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for all of the stakeholders..
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer’s team is very well skilled about the whole context (professional developers) and  they very well knows the Cardano community, TootsID is a group of expert developers that are contributing with many Open Source building blocks to the Self-Sovereign Identity ecosystem in Cardano, such as RootsWallet, WAL-CLI, and sidetree-cardano.. There are detailed career profile of the proposer team, with the Linkedin links.
The scope of the solution is well explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, what features will be developed, milestones and so on…).
In my opinion the budget requested is coherent to the challenge (24k$), and coherent with the elapsed.
The proposer provides a detailed step-by-step plan for the development
Overall I think it’s simple to define the complete success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
Success criteria is simple to identify and trace with key metrics to measure the success by tracking the milestone and tangibly verified since we are building an open source repository.
I think that the successes and metrics are qualitative verifiable but that aren’t quantitative KPIs
The proposal offers a timetable to complete the work. The proposer hasn’t considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful adoption.
The proposer have just founded other proposals from Project Catalyst and this is a continuation of these previously funded (Catalyst Fund 7 and 8) proposals which produced the Android version of RootsWallet: Open Source Credential Wallet (Fund 7), RootsWallet - Backup/Recovery (Fund 8).

f6_assessments.q0: Yes, the proposal is definitely in line with what the challenge is looking for, as it will promote the improvement of an existing dApp. In this case, it is the RootsWallet identity card, which is currently only compatible with Android phones. The idea is that those who have an iPhone can also access this SSI from Atala Prism. The project fully aligns with what the challenge seeks, generating a high-value dApp that can generate a very significant profit for Cardano, if more users adopt the technology and start using decentralized identities coined on our blockchain. We know, as proponents report, that in addition to cryptocurrencies, decentralized identities are one of the most relevant parts of the cryptographic world, and it is important that we invest in this. The main objectives of the proposal are then to promote an “adoption and growth of the Self Sovereign Identity technology in Cardano by developing Open Source code and deploying it for free use of other products”.
f6_assessments.q1: I can visualize well how the proposal would be put into practice. It is said that what would happen each week, my suggestion would be to include a little more detail in order to make the explanations accessible to all audiences, as it is a very technical proposal. Even so, it is possible to understand how the work of creating the version of the dApp for Iphone would be done. The way the total $24K budget is split is quite simple to understand once we know the value of the parts and how many hours they take (e.g. in: “Integrate new SDK into code: 20 hours = $2000 Replace the wal-lib functions: 80 hours = $8,000”). And the professionals involved, Rodolfo and Lance, are presented very adequately. We know a lot of details about their careers and they are already funded bidders, which in itself conveys great confidence in the project.
f6_assessments.q2: Since we have 4 well-defined deliverables (the Apple App Store app, the RootsWallet open source, the documentation that explains iOS-specific RootsWallet functionality), we know very well what needs to be delivered in terms of partial results. The proponents make it clear how the Cardano community will be aware of the updates: they will use the Agile methodology, they will mint on Github data on the tools used and built, they will build progress reports, use Sprints... I believe that the auditability of the progress is close. In the case of success, we know what scenario is expected (“the RootsWallet app available for Android and iPhone devices with similar, if not identical, functionality and UI/UX”); but how would that be demonstrated to our community? My suggestion is that the proponents carry out a survey to understand the satisfaction of the users and how they are using the dApp, if it has contributed to the strengthening of the SSIs, in fact.

solution: RootsID will integrate the new Atala Prism Javascript SDK and build an iPhone version of RootsWallet.
experience: RootsID is a group of expert developers that are contributing with many Open Source building blocks to the Self-Sovereign Identity ecosystem in Cardano, such as RootsWallet, WAL-CLI, and sidetree-cardano. Check our full work on Github, and more details on the Teams section below.
